intro: Iryanthera tessmannii, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in musical instrument making, it is a subject of conservation concern.
